[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertParentChainBlock()] [Null MerkleTreeRoot] The check at line 344 asserts merkle root != null, but does it validate root is non-empty hash (not Hash.Empty)? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertParentChainBlock()] [ChainId Mismatch] If parentChainId is manipulated before this call, can the wrong parent chain's data be accepted at line 341? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [Duplicate Proposal] TryGetIndexingProposal at line 395 checks for existing proposals, but can race conditions allow multiple proposals for same chainId? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [Proposal Token Collision] The proposalToken at line 397 uses ConcatAndCompute(PreviousBlockHash, chainId). Can different blocks produce same token for different chainIds? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [ProposalId Generation] Context.GenerateId at line 434 might not be unique. Can an attacker force proposal ID collision to overwrite existing proposals? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [Empty ProposedCrossChainBlockData] If neither TryGetValue succeeds at lines 421-426, proposedCrossChainBlockData remains empty. Is this validated before proposal creation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [SendInline Failure] If SendInline fails at line 416, does the function handle it, or continue creating invalid proposal state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: ProposeCrossChainBlockData()] [Expired Time Manipulation] ExpiredTime is set at line 408 by adding fixed seconds. Can long proposal periods allow stale data to be indexed? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: HandleIndexingProposal()] [ToBeReleased Check] The assertion at line 459 checks proposal.ToBeReleased, but can an attacker manipulate this flag between check and Release call at line 460? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: HandleIndexingProposal()] [Release Reentrancy] Can the SendInline Release call at line 460 cause reentrancy back into cross-chain contract, allowing proposal manipulation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.CrossChain/CrossChainContract_Helper.cs] [Function: HandleIndexingProposal()] [Proposal Null] If GetCrossChainProposal returns null at line 458, does the ToBeReleased check throw null reference exception? (Medium)
